definitions.definition: (auxiliary verb, defective) To know how to; to be able to.
definitions.example: She can speak English, French, and German.   I can play football.   Can you remember your fifth birthday?

definitions.definition: (modal auxiliary verb, defective) May; to be permitted or enabled to.
definitions.example: You can go outside and play when you're finished with your homework.   Can I use your pen?

definitions.definition: (modal auxiliary verb, defective) To have the potential to; be possible.
(auxiliary verb, defective) Used with verbs of perception.
To know.
A more or less cylindrical vessel for liquids, usually of steel or aluminium, but sometimes of plastic, and with a carrying handle over the top.
A container used to carry and dispense water for plants (a watering can).
A tin-plate canister, often cylindrical, for preserved foods such as fruit, meat, or fish.
A chamber pot, now a toilet or lavatory.
definitions.example: Bob's in the can. You can wait a few minutes or just leave it with me.

definitions.definition: Buttocks.
Jail or prison.
definitions.example: Bob's in the can. He won't be back for a few years.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) Headphones.
A drinking cup.
A cube-shaped buoy or marker used to denote a port-side lateral mark
A chimney pot.
(in the plural) an E-meter used in Scientology auditing.
To seal in a can.
definitions.example: They canned air to sell as a novelty to tourists.

definitions.definition: To preserve by heating and sealing in a jar or can.
definitions.example: They spent August canning fruit and vegetables.

definitions.definition: To discard, scrap or terminate (an idea, project, etc.).
definitions.example: He canned the whole project because he thought it would fail.

definitions.definition: To shut up.
To fire or dismiss an employee.
definitions.example: The boss canned him for speaking out.

definitions.definition: To hole the ball.
